thread.title: Baskar, Prasanna win gold at IWAS Games
thread.title_full: Baskar, Prasanna win gold at IWAS Games - The Times of India

author: Biju Babu Cyriac
title: Baskar, Prasanna win gold at IWAS Games
text:
BENGALURU: India's Baskar emerged as the fastest athlete in the F-44 class as India added two gold and two bronze medals to their kitty in the IWAS World Games in Sochi, Russia.
Baskar won the 100m dash in 12.55 seconds leaving behind Rufat Khabibullin (13.19 seconds) of Kazakhstan and Sergey Tskhovrebov (17.68s) of Russia who took the silver and bronze medals respectively.
Prasanna Kumar RT, from Karnataka's Chitradurga district, won India's second gold in men's javelin throw in F-42 class touching a distance of 45.10 metres. Derik Schutte of South Africa won the silver with 44.65m and Dechko Ovcharov of Bulgaria the bronze with 42.62m at the South Sports Athletics Centre.
In women's shot put F-54 class, Manjula became the first India woman to win a medal as she bagged the bronze with a clearance of 2.49 metres.
In swimming, SN Jadhav won the country's first medal of the Games from the pool when he finished third in men's 200m individual medley. Competing in the SM 7 class, Jadhav finished in 2 minutes, 59.13 seconds. Russians Sergey Sukharev (2:50.20s) and Andrei Gladkov (2:54.10s) took the gold and silver medals.
India's tally now read two gold, one silver and two bronze medals. Earlier, London Paralympics silver medalist HN Girisha had won a silver in men's high jump.
